Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.cache

Class HashCache<K,V>

java.lang.Object
ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.cache.HashCache<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - the type of keys maintained by this cache
V - the type of mapped values
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cache<K,V>
public class HashCache<K,V> extends Object implements Cache<K,V>
Implementation of Cache based on ConcurrentHashMap

  • Method Details

    • getBackingMap

      @NotNull public @NotNull ConcurrentMap<K,V> getBackingMap()
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Retrieves the underlying ConcurrentMap that backs this cache.

      This map provides direct access to the cached key-value pairs and can be used for operations that require more control or inspection of the cache contents. It is important to note that modifications to this map should be performed cautiously to maintain cache integrity.

      Specified by:
      getBackingMap in interface Cache<K,V>
      Returns:
      the underlying ConcurrentMap backing this cache

    • put

      public void put(K key, V value)
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Associates the specified value with the specified key in this cache. If the cache previously contained a mapping for the key, the old value is replaced by the specified value.

      This operation is thread-safe and can be used concurrently by multiple threads without compromising the cache's integrity.

      Specified by:
      put in interface Cache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - key with which the specified value is to be associated
      value - value to be associated with the specified key

    • putAll

      public void putAll(Map<? extends K,? extends V> m)
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Copies all the mappings from the specified map to this cache. The effect of this call is equivalent to that of calling Cache.put(Object, Object) on this cache once for each mapping from key to value in the specified map.

      If the cache previously contained mappings for any of the keys, the old values are replaced by the specified values.

      This operation is thread-safe and can be used concurrently by multiple threads.

      Specified by:
      putAll in interface Cache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      m - mappings to be stored in this cache

    • invalidate

      public void invalidate(Object key)
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Removes the mapping for a single key from this cache if it is present.

      If the cache contains a mapping for the specified key, it is removed. If the cache does not contain a mapping for the key, no action is taken.

      This operation is thread-safe and can be used concurrently by multiple threads.

      Specified by:
      invalidate in interface Cache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - key whose mapping is to be removed from the cache

    • invalidateAll

      public void invalidateAll(Iterable<?> keys)
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Removes the mappings for the specified keys from this cache if present.

      Each key in the provided Iterable is processed, and if a mapping exists for that key in the cache, it is removed.

      This operation is thread-safe and can be used concurrently by multiple threads.

      Specified by:
      invalidateAll in interface Cache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      keys - keys whose mappings are to be removed from the cache

    • invalidateAll

      public void invalidateAll()
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Removes all the mappings from this cache. The cache will be empty after this call returns.

      This operation is thread-safe and can be used concurrently by multiple threads.

      Use this method with caution, as it will clear all cached data, which may affect application performance if the cache is heavily utilized.

      Specified by:
      invalidateAll in interface Cache<K,V>

    • get

      public V get(Object key)
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this cache contains no mapping for the key.

      This operation is thread-safe and can be used concurrently by multiple threads.

      Specified by:
      get in interface Cache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - the key whose associated value is to be returned
      Returns:
      the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if no mapping exists

    • get

      public V get(K key, ThrowingFunction<? super K,? extends V> function)
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, computing it using the provided mapping function if it is not already present.

      If the key is not already associated with a value, the mappingFunction is invoked with the key as its argument and its result is inserted into the cache.

      This method is thread-safe and ensures that the mapping function is applied at most once per key.

      Specified by:
      get in interface Cache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - key with which the specified value is to be associated
      function - the function to compute a value
      Returns:
      the current (existing or computed) value associated with the specified key

    • approximateSize

      public int approximateSize()

    • size

      public int size()
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Returns the number of key-value mappings in this cache.

      This method provides a snapshot of the cache size at the moment of invocation and may not reflect concurrent modifications.

      This operation is thread-safe and can be used concurrently by multiple threads.

      Specified by:
      size in interface Cache<K,V>
      Returns:
      the number of key-value mappings in this cache

    • close

      public void close()
      Description copied from interface: Cache
      Closes this cache and releases any resources associated with it.

      After invoking this method, the cache should not be used for further operations. Implementations may perform cleanup tasks such as shutting down background threads or persisting cache data.

      This operation is idempotent; invoking it multiple times has no additional effect.

      Specified by:
      close in interface Cache<K,V>
